title: Oracle Database Administration 19c
description: Master Oracle Database Administration 19c with a comprehensive 64-hour course. Learn essential DBA responsibilities, database architecture, backup and recovery, user security, performance tuning, and more. Gain hands-on experience with Oracle tools like SQL*Plus, SQL Developer, RMAN, and Data Pump, all under expert guidance.

topics: Installing Oracle Database 19c on Oracle Enterprise Linux

courseOutline.title: 4. Oracle Database Management Tools

title: Oracle Database Design and Development: SQL, PL/SQL, APEX
description: Become a full-stack web developer in 12 weeks. Learn HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and back-end technologies to build dynamic, interactive websites.Learn the basics of programming with Python, covering essential concepts like variables, data types, loops, and functions.Everything you need to learn app development in 1 course. With 72 live classes and 240 pre-recorded videos, you'll learn everything from the very basics to advanced levels! Along with technical support, mental support, job placement support, and lifetime access to everything!

courseOutline.title: 1. Introduction to Oracle Database
topics: Architecture and components of Oracle database
Installation and configuration of Oracle Database

courseOutline.title: 2. SQL (Structured Query Language)
topics: Basic SQL Queries: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE commands
Filtering (WHERE), sorting (ORDER BY), and grouping (GROUP BY)
Advanced SQL Queries: Joins (INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL)
Aggregate Functions: SUM, COUNT, AVG, MIN, MAX
Window Functions: Using OVER clause (ROW_NUMBER, RANK, LEAD, LAG)
Transactions and Concurrency Control: COMMIT, ROLLBACK, SAVEPOINT
Performance Tuning in SQL: Indexing, EXPLAIN PLAN

courseOutline.title: 3. PL/SQL (Procedural Language/SQL)
topics: PL/SQL Fundamentals: Introduction and integration with SQL
Control Structures: Loops (FOR, WHILE), Conditional statements (IF-ELSE, CASE)
Exception Handling: Handling errors with EXCEPTION block
Procedures, Functions, and Packages: Creating and managing
Writing reusable packages and understanding package structure
Triggers: BEFORE, AFTER, INSTEAD OF triggers for data integrity
Cursors: Implicit and explicit cursors, Cursor for loops
Bulk collect and FORALL for performance improvement

courseOutline.title: 4. Oracle APEX (Application Express)
topics: Introduction to Oracle APEX: Overview and installation
Creating Web Applications: Building basic web applications
Interactive Reports and Forms: Designing and customizing
Advanced Features in APEX: Dynamic actions, JavaScript, and CSS customization
Deploying and Managing APEX Applications: Security, session state, and performance
Integrating APEX with Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, and RESTful web services

courseOutline.title: 5. Advanced Database Design
topics: Database Normalization: First to higher normal forms
Reducing redundancy and improving data integrity
Data Modeling and ER Diagrams: Using tools like Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler
Mapping ER diagrams to database structures
Indexes, Constraints, and Relationships: Primary/foreign keys, unique and check constraints
Data Integrity and Security: User roles, privileges, data encryption, and auditing

courseOutline.title: 6. Real-World Project
topics: Using SQL, PL/SQL, and APEX for real-world project development
Hands-on experience with data design, querying, and web development

title: Web Development: PHP, Laravel
description: Learn machine learning from scratch, including supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, and practical projects to solidify your understanding.Learn the basics of programming with Python, covering essential concepts like variables, data types, loops, and functions.Everything you need to learn app development in 1 course. With 72 live classes and 240 pre-recorded videos, you'll learn everything from the very basics to advanced levels! Along with technical support, mental support, job placement support, and lifetime access to everything!

courseOutline.title: 1. Introduction to Web Development
topics: Overview of web development: Frontend vs Backend
Basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

courseOutline.title: 2. Introduction to PHP
topics: What is PHP? Introduction to server-side development
PHP syntax and structure (variables, operators, expressions, and data types)
Working with strings, arrays, and numbers
Functions and basic object-oriented programming (OOP) principles
File handling: Reading, writing, and uploading files

courseOutline.title: 3. Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in PHP
topics: Core OOP Concepts: Classes, objects, constructors, and destructors
Advanced OOP Concepts: Inheritance, polymorphism, interfaces, and abstract classes
PHP’s Exception Handling: Try-catch blocks and custom exceptions

courseOutline.title: 4. Introduction to MySQL & Database Management
topics: What is MySQL? Introduction to relational databases
Setting up a MySQL database and user privileges
Connecting PHP with MySQL using mysqli and PDO
Handling SQL injection vulnerabilities with prepared statements

courseOutline.title: 5. Introduction to Laravel Framework
topics: Setting up a local development environment (XAMPP, Homestead, Docker)
Routing in Laravel: Route parameters, named routes, groups, and middleware
Blade Templating Engine: Working with templates, layouts, and directives

courseOutline.title: 6. Laravel Fundamentals
topics: Controllers: Creating and managing controllers, RESTful and resource controllers
Models and Eloquent ORM: Relationships, query scopes, and advanced queries
Laravel Migrations and Seeding: Creating/modifying tables, seeding data, and rolling back migrations

courseOutline.title: 7. Forms and Validation in Laravel
topics: Form Handling: Creating and processing forms
Validating form data using built-in validation rules
Writing custom validation rules and error messages
File Uploads: Handling uploads and saving files securely

courseOutline.title: 8. Authentication and Authorization
topics: User Authentication: Built-in authentication, customizing login, registration, and password reset
Authorization and Policies: Gates, policies, and role-based access control (RBAC)

courseOutline.title: 9. Working with APIs in Laravel
topics: Introduction to RESTful APIs and design principles
Building APIs: Routes, controllers, and JSON responses
API Authentication using Laravel Passport or Sanctum
Consuming APIs using Laravel’s HTTP client

courseOutline.title: 10. Advanced Laravel Features
topics: Queues and Jobs: Background tasks with Laravel queues
Event Broadcasting: Real-time events using Laravel Echo and WebSockets
Testing: Unit and feature tests with PHPUnit
Debugging and Error Handling: Laravel’s debug tools and Debugbar

courseOutline.title: 11. Deployment and Maintenance
topics: Deploying Laravel Applications: Shared hosting, VPS, DigitalOcean, Heroku
Using Git, Composer, and Envoyer for deployment
Configuring environment settings (.env file, database, and cache)
Performance Optimization: Caching, routing, and database indexing
Monitoring and Maintenance: Logging, backups, and system monitoring

courseOutline.title: 12. Real-World Project
topics: Building a Complete Laravel Web Application (e.g., blog, e-commerce site, task manager)
Implementing features: User registration, authentication, CRUD, and API integration
Deploying the project to a production environment
